item.title: Payrolls rose 22,000 in August, less than expected in further sign of hiring slowdown
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 75,000 in August while the unemployment rate edged up tp 4.3%.

item.title: Businesses bringing back recession specials could be the latest sign of deteriorating consumer sentiment
item.description: The term "recession" has popped up again as a selling point this summer, perhaps providing a look at how businesses are reacting to consumer sentiment...

item.title: Trump finalizes Japan trade deal with 15% tariffs as Ishiba faces discontent from within party
item.description: The deal was agreed in July after months of talks, with Washington and Tokyo continuing to haggle over details for weeks before finalizing the terms.

item.title: Labor market growth slows dramatically in August with U.S. adding just 54,000 jobs, ADP says
item.description: U.S. private-sector hiring rose less than expected in August, according to ADP.

item.title: Job openings data falls to levels rarely seen since pandemic
item.description: The Job Openings and Labor Turnover report showed less than 7.2 million listings in July.
